title: Nil Giri
details:
Nil Giri, situated in Bandarban, is one of the highest peaks in Bangladesh and a prominent tourist destination. Perched at an altitude of around 2,200 feet, Nil Giri offers breathtaking views of rolling hills, lush greenery, and mist-covered landscapes. During winter, visitors can often witness clouds floating around the hills, creating a surreal experience.

Reaching Nil Giri involves an adventurous journey through winding mountain roads. The area is managed by the Bangladesh Army and features well-maintained facilities, including accommodations, a restaurant, and a viewpoint. Visitors can stay overnight in cottages to enjoy the sunrise and sunset, which are the main highlights of this destination.

Nil Giri is also home to tribal communities like the Marma and Mro, offering a chance to explore their unique culture and traditions. Local handicrafts, tribal cuisines, and warm hospitality add to the experience, making it a memorable trip for nature and adventure enthusiasts alike.
seasons: Winter (November to February): The weather is cool and the skies are clear, perfect for enjoying panoramic views.
Monsoon (June to September): The hills are lush and vibrant, though the roads may be slippery.
cautions: Drive carefully on steep and winding mountain roads.
Ensure to carry warm clothes during winter visits as temperatures drop significantly.
Respect the local tribal culture and traditions during your visit.
specials: One of the highest peaks in Bangladesh, offering stunning views of rolling hills and misty landscapes.
Sunrise and sunset views that are truly magical.
Opportunity to explore the unique culture and handicrafts of the local tribal communities.
Army-managed facilities, including cozy cottages and a restaurant, ensure a comfortable stay.
